How to Generate PDF Documentation

  1. Navigate to the documentation page you want to export
  2. Press Ctrl + P (Windows/Linux) or Cmd + P (Mac) to open the print dialog
  3. In the "Destination" dropdown, select "Save as PDF"
  4. Configure your preferred settings:
    • Paper size (A4 or Letter)
    • Margins (recommended: Default)
    • Scale (recommended: 100%)
    • Background graphics (enable for better formatting)
  5. Click "Save" and choose your download location

üí° Pro Tips

  • For the complete documentation, start from the main documentation page and include all pages
  • Use the browser's "Print Preview" to check the layout before saving
  • Consider using landscape orientation for pages with wide code blocks or tables
  • The PDF will include the current theme (light/dark) - switch to your preferred theme before printing

Alternative: Command-Line PDF Generation

For automated PDF generation, you can use tools like:

  • Prince - Professional HTML to PDF converter
  • wkhtmltopdf - Open source command line tool
  • Puppeteer - Headless Chrome automation (already included in the project)

To generate PDFs programmatically, run:

npm run generate-pdf
